utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Grande skim latte, two pumps sugar free vanilla.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I think you’ve read my mind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Surgery?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Sometimes the scar pulls a bit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you still don’t remember anything about that day?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s blank.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Who knew cement overcoats would be back for fall?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: I need to chisel out the concrete by hand before I can autopsy, but it’s pretty clear she was shot to death.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Well there’s two slugs in the dirt. Looks to be a 9mm. The guy was a pro. Double tap. One to the back of the head, she falls, then he hits her again to be sure. Buries her in the sand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then waits for the cement truck to come in the morning to finish off the job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Execution style murder, cement trucks … can anyone else say mob hit? I’m looking at concrete evidence right here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that purse from here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, according to her Pierce College ID our victim’s name is Jane Herzfeld.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: College student? That’s not a typical mob victim.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Called in a favor to ballistics, we should get results today. You reach the next of kin?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mother’s on her way in. Jane was an only child.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s a hell of a thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. She also had a roommate in Michigan visiting friends, but she’s back tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was this girl into that got her dumped into a ditch?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: As far as I could tell, all she was into was tutoring other students. She was booked solid for the day she died. What’s weird is that she cancelled her appointments that morning. Her students say that wasn’t like her. She was super conscientious.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did she tell them why she was cancelling?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All she said was something important had come up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe she knew she was in trouble.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m putting the time of death between 10 and 12 midnight. And I found this. Bruising. No more than a day old.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He must have grabbed her. Maybe forced her into a car?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Also I found traces of cocaine residue on her shirt but the preliminary tox is clean. No drugs or alcohol in her system.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The killer could have transferred it to her shirt when he walked her to the murder site.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: From the looks of it, she knew she was going to die. I found this clutched in her fist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He let her say a prayer before he shot her. That’s not very professional.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. More like Jane knew her killer.

utterance.speaker: MRS HERZFELD
utterance.content: When I didn’t hear from her last night I knew something was wrong. We always talked at the end of the day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Herzfeld, Jane was tutoring people to make extra cash. Do you know why she cancelled all her appointments yesterday?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it possible that Jane was doing something other than tutoring? Something that might have gotten her into trouble?

utterance.speaker: MRS HERZFELD
utterance.content: Something like what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we didn’t find any drugs in Jane’s system, but the ME did find traces of cocaine on her clothes.

utterance.speaker: MRS HERZFELD
utterance.content: Jane would never be involved with drugs!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but she might have been involved with people who were. And we think that she knew her killer.

utterance.speaker: MRS HERZFELD
utterance.content: There was a boyfriend I didn’t like. They broke up five months ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did you not like about him?

utterance.speaker: MRS HERZFELD
utterance.content: He wouldn’t meet my eye. They would fight. I saw bruises on her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember his name?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Finnbar Joseph McQueen, aka Finn. Did a deuce on cocaine charges, possession with intent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that would explain the residue that Lanie found on her body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: B and E, simple assault … there’s nothing gun related.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he decided to step up the game. Do we have a location on this guy?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s the best part. I talked to McQueen’s parole officer. He says that McQueen is doing a job on 645 West 98th Street. Construction.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: I can’t believe it. I can’t believe she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw Jane?

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: Um … a couple weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well … you broke up in April, so … you stayed in touch?

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: I – I was her friend. Yeah, I – I helped her out every now and then. I uh, lent her money once, she paid me back. Like that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did Jane have money problems?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And as a friend, did you maybe tell her you that could hook her up? Got her involved in something she couldn’t handle?

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: Jane wouldn’t ever do anything that wasn't clean, if that’s what you’re implying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: Jane was a good girl. That’s why it ended.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: She wanted me to go straight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And there’s no chance that’s a mistake?

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: I just couldn’t.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: I kept telling her, this is who I am.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Our man Finn? Inches from confessing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ballistics just came in. The bullet that killed Jane Herzfeld came from a gun that’s in our system. It’s a Glock 17.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well… that’s good news.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, it’s a match to your old service weapon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That can’t be right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not a mistake. The weapon that killed Jane Herzfeld… it’s yours.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She was holding a cross in her hand when she died. She was praying for mercy. And then … she heard him pull the trigger. Of my gun.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We were working the 3XK serial murders last year. We had a suspect in custody that had given us a full confession, at which time Castle and I went to the motel –

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN GATES
utterance.content: Castle was with you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, the NYPD sequestered Jerry Tyson at a motel as a witness and Castle and Ryan went over there to give him the all clear.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: At which time you realized that Tyson actually was 3XK?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes sir. Tyson got the drop on us and left with my gun and badge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Detective Ryan was cleared of any wrong doing by the IAB.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t care whose fault it is. All I care about it mitigating the damage. Which means we track down Jerry Tyson like the animal he is and we haul him into custody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I will be when Jerry Tyson’s in cuffs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett? McQueen’s alibi checks out. Waitress confirms he was at Angeline’s Diner on the West Side ‘til closing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Cut him loose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Ryan, if Tyson is the shooter, that explains Jane. No direct motive, just fits his profile. She’s young, she’s blonde –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but 3XK strangled those other women. Why would he use a gun now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He told me he likes to change up his MO.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, must have missed that when I was out cold on the floor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know Ryan, none of this is your fault. The fact that he used your gun –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That weapon was issued to me by the city of New York. I let it out of my hand and now a girl is dead. So please do not tell me that it’s not my fault.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m going to start a canvass at Jane’s apartment, have them show Tyson’s photo around. Find out when Jane’s roommate is back in town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a cop thing, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I get it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. CSU pulled information off Jane’s metro and ATM records. She spent most of yesterday at Grand Central Station.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, over a four hour period she made multiple withdrawals out of three ATMs in and around the train station. $800 worth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she canceled a day of work to hang out at a train station and empty her bank account? That was the important thing that came up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll send a team over there first thing. Have them talk to vendors, see if anyone remembers seeing anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or Tyson. He stalked his victims before he killed them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like I’ve been holding my breath for a year waiting for this day to come. A whole year of wondering about him, hating him, dreaming about him, trying to think like him, but still having no clue how to catch him.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s not your job to catch a serial killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I’m not a cop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I like to pretend I’m Beckett’s partner and I’m one of them, but days like today I realize … that I’ve just been playacting.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Your playacting once helped save New York City as I recall.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Be there for your friends. Stand beside them. Work together. That’s plenty useful. Trust me.

utterance.speaker: ROOM MATE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, no. Jane and I were only roommates for six months.

utterance.speaker: ROOM MATE
utterance.content: Maybe he was the guy she was seeing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jane had a boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: ROOM MATE
utterance.content: She wouldn’t tell me about him, and she wouldn’t let him come around.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t Jane talk about him?

utterance.speaker: ROOM MATE
utterance.content: She said he had some things he had to figure out before they could go public. Honestly I just thought maybe he was married. And like … six weeks ago, things changed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Changed how?

utterance.speaker: ROOM MATE
utterance.content: She was crying all the time and she would get phone calls really late at night and be really upset afterwards.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you remember a specific time or day when Jane got one of these calls?

utterance.speaker: ROOM MATE
utterance.content: Last Thursday? Around 11:00?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thursday night at 11:04 Jane got a call on her cell. Our guys say that call originated on a pay phone in Sandy’s Bar in midtown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Two calls a week to the same number over the last six weeks?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s him.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: I’ve seen her. A couple of times. Yeah, came in with Seth.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is this Seth?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Nah, that ain’t him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You sure? Take a good look this time.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Seth’s a regular. That ain’t him. But if you want to talk to Seth, just stick around. He usually comes in her pretty much every day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Doing what?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: He uses that phone over there a lot. Meets with shifty looking individuals he calls uh, associates. One time, his jacket rolled up in the back. He was strapped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like a drug deal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. So what time does Seth usually come in?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: About three. Stay if you want, but I’ve got to get back to work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how’s Ryan holding up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Three days after my last tour of duty in Iraq, I’m at a diner with friends. A car backfires. My friends look around, I’m under the table.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan’s just waiting for the next hit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s what I don’t get. What’s a drug dealer doing with my gun?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe Tyson sold it to him or tossed it and Seth found it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That doesn’t sound like Jerry Tyson. 3XK always has a plan. So maybe Seth is a patsy.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: How you feeling, Joe Joe?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Hey Seth, how’s it going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like you’ll be able to ask him yourself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Seth, Detective Beckett, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Back alley. He’s on the move. On the move!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop! Police!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Up against the car, right now!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Gun. It’s a Glock 17.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got a permit for this?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Sure do, Ponch. I’m a cop. Detective Seth Carver, narcotics. Now do me a favor and put me in the car before you blow my cover completely, will ya?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: So let me guess. You talked to her mom and her girlfriends and all of them said that Jane was an angel. Am I right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So are you saying she wasn’t?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: I’m saying that when I met her I was pulling her over for blowing a red light and she had 2 grams in the glove compartment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jane didn’t do drugs.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: What did I tell you? Lilttle miss was riding dirty.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You didn’t – you didn’t charge her. There’s nothing – there’s nothing in the system.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Right. That’s because when I asked her where the coke came from, she told me Ben Lee gave it to her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who’s Ben Lee?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Who’s Ben – Son of Clifford Lee.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: He’s the head of the Hui Ye Tong. Operates out of a dim sum house on Long Street.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s the Hui Ye Tong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, the Tongs are a Chinese merchant organization. Most of them are legit but some of them are a front for the Chinese mob.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Clifford Lee would be like the Godfather.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’s Jane supposed to help you get to Clifford Lee based on one coke buy off his kid?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: When it comes to education, Clifford Lee is old school Chinese. His sons may be drug dealing criminals, but they still need to graduate college.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ben Lee was one of her students. She was tutoring him

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Twice a week she was in their house. I told her I would drop the possession charges if she brought me some solid intel on Lee’s criminal operations. She said okay. And somehow she tipped them off and they killed her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s it?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: I just handed you a solid lead, what do you want, some more? What is this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. How about the truth?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Ryan. Keep it together.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You expect us to believe you work a case for years and one lucky Saturday night you just happen to roll up on the perfect CI?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: See, I did my time in narcotics, Carver. I know a shortcut when I hear one.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Not you, Ryan. If I didn’t know any better, I would think you were accusing me of something untoward. Whoa. Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You targeted Jane Herzfeld. You planted those drugs in her car and then you made her help you out. You – you sent her in there alone! No back up, no protection, and now she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: Yeah well, I didn’t make her dead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The hell you didn’t. You may have not pulled the trigger but you’re as guilty as the creep who did.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: What about you, man? Look at yourself. Word around the house is that that creep used your gun. What kind of cop can’t keep a hold of his own weapon?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Say it! I want you to say it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Break it up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Break it up. We’re all cops here, okay?

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: If you’re done, I think I’ll take my leave now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks for your help, Carver.

utterance.speaker: SETH
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you trying to do? Do you want the Captain to come in here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go cool off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The guy’s a jerk.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When I started in narcotics, I was so green I didn’t know how things got done.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: One day there’s this major bust, street gang cooking meth. They were stacking up guys in the bullpen, taking their statements one by one. Place is a zoo. I’m answering phones in the squad, there’s a girl on the line, name of Alicia, asking for my lieutenant, so I call out across the bullpen “hey Lieu! Alicia’s on the phone for ya.”

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It was her tip got these guys nailed and all of them just heard me call out her name.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Searched all day and all night looking for her before the gang could get word back to the street that she was a nark.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, did you find her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I did. I got her into Witness Protection but … that was the stupidest thing I’d ever done as a cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh…

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Until the day Jerry Tyson got the drop on me and stole my weapon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Carver is a jerk. But he’s got a point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what Carver could have a point about is Ben Lee. If Ben did tip to Jane, then that’s a strong motive. You up for a trip to Chinatown?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hell yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Uniforms at Grand Central caught a break. They found a clerk who works at a mailbox center around the corner who says he rented a box to Jane the day she died. I’m going to go check it out. You want to roll with me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, I’m with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you want to come?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh? I – I was just thinking. If our killer is someone in Lee’s organization, then he must have gotten your gun from Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means our killer may know Tyson’s whereabouts. We nail him, we nail 3XK.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s nothing in Tyson’s background that indicates a connection to the Chinese mob.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe the shooter is connected to the Lees. Someone Tyson crossed paths with during his 4 years in prison. Someone working for the Tong. If I find out who that someone is, maybe we have our shooter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wading through 4 years of prison records it’s … a lot of work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CLIFFORD LEE
utterance.content: Detectives. I assume you’re here about Jane.

utterance.speaker: CLIFFORD LEE
utterance.content: Please, sit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I understand Jane was an employee of yours, is that correct?

utterance.speaker: CLIFFORD LEE
utterance.content: She tutored my son, Ben. Oh, this is Ben. My other sons, Phillip, David, Steven.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw Jane, Ben?

utterance.speaker: BEN LEE
utterance.content: Last week. We had an appointment the day before yesterday, but she cancelled.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where would you meet?

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: Sometimes at school, sometimes at my house.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was Jane a good tutor? Did you like her, Ben?

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: She was okay.

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP LEE
utterance.content: What’s with all these questions? He just said he hadn’t seen her.

utterance.speaker: CLIFFORD LEE
utterance.content: Phillip.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The truth is, Mr. Lee, we’ve uncovered some information about Jane that a man in your line of work might find troubling.

utterance.speaker: CLIFFORD LEE
utterance.content: You mean that she was an informant.

utterance.speaker: CLIFFORD LEE
utterance.content: Jane told me herself, about a month ago. She said that a bad cop had framed her and is forcing her to help him. I told her that there was nothing to tell this man about us because we are honest businessmen. I hoped the officer would grow tired of waiting and leave her alone, but unfortunately that did not happen. I’m afraid your killer may be closer to home than you think.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve already ruled out Detective Carver.

utterance.speaker: CLIFFORD LEE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And what were you … honest … businessmen doing between 10PM and midnight on the night Jane was killed?

utterance.speaker: CLIFFORD LEE
utterance.content: We were home, watching television. Please feel free to speak to any of my household staff if you wish to verify this information.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We will.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Dad. What’s all that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Convict reports. I’m trying to figure out which bad guy Jerry Tyson gave Ryan’s gun to.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Any luck?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m looking for the proverbial needle in the haystack.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somewhere in that box is the link to Tyson. I’m just not seeing it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, I’d offer to help but I’ve got all these complaint letters to read.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, did you drop out of school and get a job in consumer relations?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. The senior class made me their Executive Liaison Advocate to the Administration.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that sounds like quite an honor.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ivy League schools look fondly on applicants who serve in student government. Alexis is beefing up her resume before she reapplies to Stanford.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Or anywhere. If I even go to college at all.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Chelsea’s been our advocate for the last 3 years. And when I told her I wanted to be more involved, she offered to step aside and let me take over the position.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that was nice of her.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Again with the not really.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I didn’t know when I agreed to do it, but you just sit there. For hours and hours and listen to everyone complain and – I think Chelsea just got tired of it and figured she could stick me with the job. And I thought she was my friend, but I guess …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Face it, kiddo. Chelsea set you up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She set you up. Your friend set you up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The Lees' entire household staff confirms that the family was at home watching television the night Jane Herzfeld was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, there’s no surprise there. Hey, how’d it go at Grand Central?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Good. I found this. Check the tag. It belongs to Jane Herzfeld.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where was it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: At the mailbox center where Jane bought a box. She was using it to hold this bag along with $500 in cash.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hum… there’s men’s clothes and toiletries mixed up in here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And two tickets on the late train to Phoenix for the night she died. She was looking to get out of town but she wasn’t going alone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No names, so who was going with her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her mystery man. Her roommate said she was dating someone. Someone who had some stuff to work out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And Carver kept hassling her to betray the Lees. Maybe they figured it was just smarter to get out of town. But why Phoenix?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe a dryer climate. It’s an asthma inhaler. But according to the autopsy report, Jane didn’t have asthma. So it must have belonged to the guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No prescription sticker, but there’s a barcode.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m going to call the manufacturer and have them trace it. Oh, and in case her traveling companion was waiting outside for her, I pulled video from the bank’s security cameras next door to the mailbox center.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, stop. There’s Jane.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who’s that with her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Finn McQueen, Jane’s ex-boyfriend. He told us he hasn’t talked to Jane in weeks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jane was leaving town with Finn?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah, he’s too tall for the clothes in that bag. It’s not him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa. It looks like he’s trying to talk her out of going.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s that in his jacket?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That would be a weapon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like a Glock.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: CSU found it under your mattress. Where’d you get the gun, Finn?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I noticed the serial numbers have been filed off and that’s the same type of weapon that was used to kill Jane.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: That is not mine. And your guy confirmed my alibi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alibis can be bought. Video doesn’t lie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You knew that Jane was leaving town and you knew she was in love with someone else, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He keeps saying he didn’t do it, but that’s a man with a guilty conscience.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett! Beckett! We got word from ballistics.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No match. The gun’s a Glock 17 but it’s not mine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Detective Esposito.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know who the killer is!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks for getting back to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we just got some bad news, so no hypotheticals. Just give us a name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I have to start at the beginning -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jin Hai Li Chang.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, start from the beginning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. So I realized last night, 3XK would never give a cop’s gun to a friend. A gun that hot would be a curse, not a blessing, but he would give it to an enemy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So …?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I went over all the incident reports involving Jerry Tyson during his 4 years at Sing Sing and one report in particular stood out. Tyson got into it with a guy in a weight yard and he ended up in the infirmary with a broken jaw. The jaw breaker’s name? Jin Hai Li Chang. Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s Phillip, Clifford Lee’s oldest son.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Apparently Papa Clifford Anglicized the family’s names when they moved into the country but they never bothered to make them legal. That’s why it took me so long to find it. When Phillip got his weapons charge in 2008, he was booked under his Chinese name.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But … Phillip and Tyson were sworn enemies. Why would Phillip accept the gun?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The two eventually became friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It happens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not with Jerry Tyson. That guy doesn’t have any friends. He’s a psychopath. He wanted payback and he was willing to wait.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tyson sold Phillip my gun, hoping he’d use it in the future.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when Phillip found out that Jane was an informant, he did just that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, Phillip’s motive may have been a little more personal than that. The barcode on the inhaler that we found in Jane’s bag? That inhaler was issued to one Ling Mi Chang, better known as Ben Lee.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jane was leaving town with Ben.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So student and tutor become boyfriend and girlfriend. They were in love. It’s Romeo and Juliet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Jane did have a thing for reforming bad boys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but Asian gangs? You’re in for life. There’s no walking away.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, like Romeo and Juliet, someone ended up dead. Brother Phillip found out about their plans to go to Phoenix together so he murdered Jane to keep little brother in the fold.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a great theory, guys. There’s just one thing missing. Evidence? Eye witness accounts? Something to make this case stick.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know someone who can help us out.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: You here to let me out?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not to let you out, Finn. To set you free.

utterance.speaker: FINN
utterance.content: You cops, man. What’s that supposed to mean? Set me free?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The truth, Finn. The truth sets you free. I’ve been looking for it all night. I finally found it. Who knew the truth would be hiding in a juvie report from 1996? You got grabbed up for moving paper for a Chinatown bookie. Do you remember who bailed you out? Hmm? Clifford Lee. You’ve been working for the Lees for years. Little jobs, because well, let’s face it, you’re kind of a screw up. But you wanted more. So when you found out Ben Lee needed a tutor, you recommended your ex, Jane, thinking it would earn you points with the family. And you watched it all go sideways. Jane and Ben fell in love, decided to leave town. You thought, what if the family blamed you? Because no one leaves the family business. Not even for love. So, you tried to make her change her mind. You fought. But you couldn’t change her mind. So you made a call to Phillip, and then Phillip went and got Jane.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And this, Finn? I talked to her mother. She says you gave this cross to Jane on her 21st birthday. She was holding it when she died. For comfort. Because she knew she was going to die.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She was so afraid.

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY
utterance.content: Let me make sure I’ve got this straight. Finn McQueen claims that he phoned my client and told him that his brother Ben was leaving town with Jane Herzfeld, to which my client allegedly replied, “I’ll take care of it." Is that all you’ve got?

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY
utterance.content: We’ve already established that Phillip was at home with his family when the girl was shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, why was his cell phone on West 12th Street?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Your client made a phone call to his parents' house at 11:30PM. That call pinged off a tower off the West Side highway, which is a couple blocks from our murder scene. Were you calling your father, letting him know the job was done?

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY
utterance.content: Please, Detective. His phone pinged? You know that’s not enough to charge him with murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not yet, but give me some time. Listen, if your client wants to talk deal –

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY
utterance.content: Dream on. Let’s go, Phillip.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You killed that girl. You used my weapon to do it and now I carry that weight. Trust me when I say to you that I will not rest until I make you carry it, too.

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY
utterance.content: Hey! We’re done here. And if you attempt to contact my client or his family again without first notifying my office, we’ll sue the department for harassment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Okay. We’ve got it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: This is the second time you’ve gone at the Lees with nothing. Now Phillip Lee has lawyered up, he’s probably gotten rid of the gun, and he has four family members and various household staff willing to alibi him for the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The cell phone puts him in the vicinity of the murder scene.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Vicinity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Finn McQueen says –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Finn McQueen cannot testify to what happened, Castle. He wasn’t there. Make your case. But you do it now, without harassing the Lee family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, we need to keep leaning on them. We need to keep the heat on.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No, you need to stay away. And that’s an order.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what? We just write the name of Jane’s killer in a file and we let him walk free? That makes us clerks, not cops.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Take the rest of the day off, Ryan. You need to clear your head.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s not over yet, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I just need someone to go on record, someone who knows what happened that night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but the only one that really knows is Phillip Lee.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m going to do just like the Captain said, take the rest of the day off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Wherever you’re going, I’m going with you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s my fight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you don’t want me getting involved. It’s my case, too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you’re my partner.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m taking a run at Ben Lee.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The Lees will have him locked down. I’m betting his old man won’t let him go out in public alone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then I guess we can’t go in there looking like cops.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, snap! Is that Phillip?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, what’s good, son? I haven’t seen you in a minute. Man, how’ve you been?

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: He thinks I’m my brother. Happens with the gweilo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: BODYGUARD
utterance.content: Move along.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Man, why are you touching up on me? Hey man, you better check your totem. Hey Phillip, tell them that we boys. Tell your boy Thor that we boys.

utterance.speaker: BODYGUARD
utterance.content: Go outside. You can call Phillip on his cell later.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Phillip, tell him – man, you’ve changed, Phillip.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Ben.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: You shouldn’t be here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I just want to talk.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: About Jane.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: Jane is dead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you just let it all die with her? What happened, huh? College maybe got you thinking there’s something better out there than being a low life drug dealer? Jane made you really want to try?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You can still get out. And I promise you’ll be safe.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: You cops and your promises, man. Carver promised Jane she’d be safe. Look what happened.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: You’re talking about my family.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m talking about your life. Jane died fighting your battle. I know you can honor her better than this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know how to find me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell were you two thinking, going to see Ben Lee when Gates specifically said stay away?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who’s going to tell her, Beckett? Not me. Ryan, are you planning on telling the Captain what we did?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not me. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who, me? No way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nice, smartass. And what about when Ben Lee talks to his dad and Gates gets a phone call from their lawyer? You two are going to get benched.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ben Lee’s not going to tell his father.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because. I looked him in the eye and saw the pain he’s in. Maybe he’s not man enough to stand up for himself, but he’s not going to rat me out, either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys took a hell of a chance.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett, you’re starting to sound like a boss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just let me know next time so I can help –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Ryan!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: There’s someone here to see you.

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: Papa said you were down here. I haven’t seen you work this hard.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: I have a test on Monday.

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: Blow it off. We’ll go out.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: I don’t want to go.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: Phillip? If that hadn’t found Jane, if she’d stayed hidden, I’d have never known what happened to her. Would you really have let me wonder for the rest of my life?

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: Sometimes it’s a gift, not knowing the truth.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: So if she were just missing I could believe she were alive somewhere? I could pretend? Like a child?

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: She meant something!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t like this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ben was supposed to lead Phillip to a confession, not force a confrontation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, just give him a minute.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: She’s dead. And I’m not a child.

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: In time you’ll see it was for the best.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Phillip’s dancing around it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The second he acknowledges guilt we’re moving in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: C’mon, c’mon.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: She cried. Did she ask for me?

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: Man, don’t do this.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: I need to know.

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: You’re not thinking clearly. We’ll talk about this tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: If you don’t tell me everything, we can no longer be brothers.

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: You wearing a wire?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, he’s tipping.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe Ben can turn it around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, we have to pull him out, now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just …

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: A wire? What is this? Let me see. Open your shirt.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: I don’t need to prove anything to you.

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: Ben!

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: It’s your last chance, little brother. Show me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let's go. Let’s move.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: You going to shoot me now? Like you did Jane?

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: Don’t push me.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: Go to hell.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: You ruined my life!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Gun down!

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: Ben! Ben!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s enough on the tape to sway a jury from reasonable doubt. And the coke we found in your car is a match for the residue found on Jane’s body and then, there’s this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The gun that you pointed at your brother. Detective Ryan positively identified it as his stolen service weapon. It is also the same gun that killed Jane Herzfeld.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re looking at murder one, life with no parole.

utterance.speaker: ATTORNEY
utterance.content: My client has some information that may interest the NYPD.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of information?

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: Jerry Tyson. 3XK.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about him?

utterance.speaker: PHILLIP
utterance.content: When he gave me the gun, we talked. And I know where he was headed and what name he was going to use.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, Lee wants 15 to 25 with parole in 10 for giving us Tyson’s new alias and I need to give the DA a recommendation. This might be our chance to get 3XK, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. It’s a setup. Jerry Tyson gave the gun to Phillip Lee knowing that he would use it, so there’s a good chance he knew we’d eventually get to Phillip.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe. So what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So nothing Tyson told Phillip would be the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Giving Phillip a good deal for bad information … that’s just another win for Jerry Tyson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure enough. Jane Herzfeld deserves justice. Life in prison for Phillip Lee. No deals.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ll get 3XK. And we’ll do it right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damn, Castle. Look at you, thinking like a real cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey guys. Hey, you could look a little happier. Today was a win, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I keep thinking about Seth Carver, sending Jane into the Lees all alone, no backup. Do I really get to call myself a better cop?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are a better cop, Kevin. You’re a better man. Because you didn’t send him in there alone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, there’s your boy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ben. Good to see you back on your feet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, that was a pretty impressive performance back there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, you have a future in stunt work, my friend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guys, this is Marshal Mike Drooen from Witness Protection. He’s escorting Ben to his new home in Los Angeles.

utterance.speaker: MIKE DROOEN
utterance.content: Detectives. Ben, your plane leaves in an hour.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: Thanks. I … just need a minute.

utterance.speaker: BEN
utterance.content: Thank you. I wouldn’t have had the courage to do what I did without you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, you have your life back now. Live it on your own terms. It’s what she wanted.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let's, uh … keep this party a little quiet though, all right? If the Captain hears I’m sure she’ll blame me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s going to tell her? Not me. You?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about you, Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm mmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, I think we’re good.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well then. To my partner, Kevin Ryan. A credit to the job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To Ryan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’d like to make a toast. To bravery and commitment. To love and sacrifice. To Jane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To Jane.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: To Jane.
